br.uff.midiacom.ana.rule

NCLElement<T>, XMLElement<T>
public class NCLBindRule<T extends NCLElement,Ec extends NCLBindConstituent,Er extends NCLTestRule,R extends ExternalReferenceType>
extends NCLElementPrototype<T>
implements NCLElement<T>

Class that represents the bindRule element used inside a switch or descriptor switch element.
This element defines the attributes:

  • constituent - switch element component to be related to a rule. This attribute is required.
  • rule - rule tested when selecting the descriptor to be used. This attribute is required.

Method Detail

setConstituent

public void setConstituent(Ec constituent)
                    throws XMLException
Sets the switch element component to be related to a rule. This attribute is required and can not be set to null.
The referred component must be a node internal to the switch element parent of this bindRule element.

Parameters:
constituent - element that makes reference to the component that will be related to a rule.
Throws:
XMLException - if the constituent is null or any error occur while creating the reference to the descriptor.

getConstituent

public Ec getConstituent()
Returns the switch element component descriptor to be related to a rule or null if the attribute is not defined.
The referred descriptor must be a node internal to the switch element parent of this bindRule element.

Returns:
element that makes reference to the descriptor that will be related to a rule or null if the attribute is not defined.

setRule

public void setRule(java.lang.Object rule)
             throws XMLException
Sets the rule tested when presenting the node indicated in the constituent attribute. This attribute is required and can not be set to null.
The rule referred can be defined in the document base of rules or in a base defined in an external document, imported by the base of rules or by the base of imported documents. When the rule is defined in an external document, the alias of the imported document must be indicated in the reference.

Parameters:
rule - element representing a reference to a rule element.
Throws:
XMLException - if the rule is null or any error occur while creating the reference to the rule.

getRule

public java.lang.Object getRule()
Returns the rule tested when presenting the node indicated in the constituent attribute or null if the attribute is not defined.
The rule referred can be defined in the document base of rules or in a base defined in an external document, imported by the base of rules or by the base of imported documents. When the rule is defined in an external document, the alias of the imported document must be indicated in the reference.

Returns:
element representing a reference to a rule element or null if the attribute is not defined.
